metadata.feature_description: Allows users to set custom column widths beyond predefined templates using percentage values.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Update layout with custom column sizes via drag resize

steps.action: Navigate to home page and enter edit mode by clicking Edit button in sidebar
steps.expected: Page enters edit mode showing module panes and edit controls
steps.actual: Page entered edit mode successfully, showing ContentLayout panes (F30A_Pane1-4) with Discard/Publish buttons

steps.action: Scroll to view the ContentLayout module with 4 columns (TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS)
steps.expected: ContentLayout module visible with 4 equal-width columns at 25% each
steps.actual: ContentLayout module visible showing 4 columns with equal widths and resize handles between columns

steps.action: Drag the resize handle between first and second columns to make the first column wider
steps.expected: First column should expand, second column should shrink, sizes should update
steps.actual: First column expanded to 41%, second column compressed to 9%, third and fourth columns remained at 25%

steps.action: After resizing columns, check the size viewer overlay that displays percentage values
steps.expected: Size viewers should show percentage values for each column
steps.actual: Size viewers displayed correctly showing 41%, 9%, 25%, 25% for the four columns respectively

steps.action: Verify column width percentages via browser inspection
steps.expected: Column widths should match the displayed percentages
steps.actual: Verified via JavaScript - columns had inline styles: width:41%, width:9%, width:25%, width:25%

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify CSS class generation for custom sizes

steps.action: Inspect the CSS classes applied to column panes after resizing
steps.expected: Columns should have Bootstrap grid classes with inline style overrides for custom widths
steps.actual: Columns retained Bootstrap classes (col-lg-3 col-md-4 col-sm-6 col-xs-12) with inline width styles (41%, 9%, 25%, 25%) overriding the grid

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify custom size persistence after page refresh

steps.action: Refresh the page after making column size changes
steps.expected: Live view should show original sizes (changes saved as draft), edit mode should show modified sizes
steps.actual: Live view showed original equal column widths as expected (draft not published)

steps.action: Enter edit mode after page refresh to verify draft persistence
steps.expected: Edit mode should show the custom column sizes that were saved as a draft
steps.actual: Edit mode displayed custom column widths (33%, 13%, 29%, 25%) confirming draft persistence. Module positions also rearranged based on new column widths.

steps.action: Review code validation logic for column sizes in ColumnSizesHelper.cs
steps.expected: Validation should reject: empty values, negative values, non-numeric values, more than 3 values, total > 99%
steps.actual: Code review confirmed validation rules: IsValidColumnSizes() rejects empty/null strings, values that don't parse as numbers, negative values (<=0), more than 3 comma-separated values, and totals exceeding 99%

steps.action: Review code for predefined templates in Templates/data.xml and API endpoints
steps.expected: Predefined templates should exist and be accessible via API
steps.actual: Code review confirmed 6 predefined templates exist: 25%+75%, 75%+25%, 50%+50%, 25%+50%+25%, 33%+33%+33%, 4x25%. Templates accessible via GetContentLayoutTemplates API and applied via UpdateLayoutFromTemplate API.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test responsive behavior with custom sizes

steps.action: Verify responsive CSS classes are applied to columns
steps.expected: Columns should have responsive Bootstrap classes for different screen sizes
steps.actual: Columns have responsive classes: col-lg-3 col-md-4 col-sm-6 col-xs-12, ensuring columns stack on smaller screens while using custom percentages on larger screens

observations: Predefined template selection UI is not directly visible in the main edit mode interface. Templates are applied via the UpdateLayoutFromTemplate API endpoint, suggesting template selection may be in a separate UI component or admin panel.
Custom column sizes are saved as drafts and require publishing to appear in the live view. This is standard DNN Evoq workflow versioning behavior.
The drag-resize functionality uses jQuery UI's resizable widget with minimum column width constraints (105px minimum) to prevent columns from becoming too narrow.
Column widths are calculated as percentages rounded to whole numbers, and the last column's width is automatically calculated as (100 - sum of other columns)%.
When modules are inside columns, resizing columns causes modules to reflow based on the new available space.
